etymology.description: 肖(肖) (xiào, "resemble") + 像(像) (xiàng, "image") = a resembling image -> portrait
etymology.interpretation: A 肖像(肖像) (xiàoxiàng, "portrait") is an image that resembles the appearance of a person. The character 肖(肖) (xiào, "resemble") signifies likeness, while 像(像) (xiàng, "image") denotes a representation or picture, aptly capturing the essence of a portrait.

examples.chinese: 他画了一幅精致的肖像(他畫了一幅精緻的肖像)。
examples.pinyin: Tā huà le yī fú jīngzhì de xiàoxiàng.

examples.chinese: 宫廷里悬挂着国王的肖像(宮廷裡懸掛著國王的肖像)，彰显王朝的荣耀(彰顯王朝的榮耀)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngtíng lǐ xuánguàzhe guówáng de xiàoxiàng, zhāngxiǎn wángcháo de róngyào.
examples.english: In the palace, the king's portrait hangs, showcasing the dynasty's glory.
